name: Peacemaker
description:
Abdurrahman Wahid (7 September 1940 – 30 December 2009), though more colloquially known as Gus Dur, was an Indonesian Muslim religious and political leader who served as the 4th President of Indonesia. Gus Dur is a figure who loudly defends minorities. Fair and tolerant, the two words that best describe his attitude towards the diversity of tribes, religions and cultures in Indonesia. Because of that he is dubbed the father of Indonesian pluralism

In 1993, Abdurrahman Wahid received the prestigious Magsaysay Award for his efforts to promote inter-religious relations in Indonesia within a democratic society. The award is referred to as 'Asia's Nobel Prize'.

This work is dedicated to Gusdur for his work in bringing peace in Indonesia.
